Appointment Letter

Dear {{ doc.salutation or 'Mr' }}. {{ employee.employee_name or '' }},


With reference to your application and the subsequent interview you had with us, we are pleased to appoint you as a / an {{ employee.designation or '' }} with IndiFOSS Analytical Pvt. Ltd under the following terms and conditions.


1. Date of Joining:


You are being appointed as a / an {{ employee.designation or '' }} under a Grade "{{ designation_detail.custom_employee_grade or '' }}" with IndiFOSS analytical Pvt Ltd and Your date of joining will be {{ frappe.format_date(doc.appointment_date) or '' }}.


2. Posting & Transfer :


Your initial positing will be at {{ employee.custom_district or '' }}. However, your services are liable to be transferred at the sole discretion of Management, in such other capacity as the company may determine to any department / section, location, associate, sister concern or subsidiary, at any place in India whether existing today or which may come up in future. In such a case, you will be governed by the terms and conditions of the service application at the present placement location.

Your service will be subject to the rules and regulations of the organization as may be framed from time to time.


3. Placement & Compensation


Your salary will be Rs.{{ employee.ctc }} (Rs. {{ frappe.utils.money_in_words(employee.ctc) }} only) per annum Cost to Company (CTC), and, will be entitled to compensation (salary and other applicable benefits) as detailed in Annexure attached with this appointment letter. Compensation will be governed by the rules of the Company on the subject, as application and/or amended hereafter. {{ doc.con_comt or '' }}

You will be eligible for Gratuity as per Payment of Gratuity Act. 1972. Your compensation will be subject to deductions as application under provisions of Income Tax Act. 1961 and other application laws in India. Appropriate Statutory deductions will be applicable on your salary.

The information about your compensation is personal and strictly confidential. Please do not share these details with any person or organization internally or externally.


4.Documentation :


It is mandatory to provide all the HR related document like your photo id, residence proof, certificates, and other related documents at the time of joining. If you don't have them presently in your possession, you may provide the same within fifteen days from joining the organization.

It will be your responsibility to inform us prior in writing or in any other form, if there are any changes related to your residential address, personal information or etc,. In case of failure, you shall be responsible and liable for any loss or damage to you or the organisation in any form arising due to this failure.


5. Past Records


If any declaration given or information furnished by you to the company proves to be false, or if you are found to have wilfully suppressed any material information, in such cases you will be liable to be removed from services without any notice or reasons explained thereof.


6. Attendance:


You are expected to follow the attendance registration process and attendance policy of the company. Absence for a continuous period of ten days without prior approval of your superior, (including overstay on leave / training) would result in your losing your lien on the service and the same shall automatically come to an end without any notice or intimation.


7.Leave:


You will be eligible to avail the benefits of Company's Leave policy upon getting confirmed in the Company's Service. Approval of leave/s will be sole discretion of your reporting manager. Leave policy may change from time to time and management reserves the right to any modifications.


8. Expenses:


The company shall reimburse all your expenses incurred for performance of your Company duties upon submission of receipts. Reimbursement should be within the limits specified in the policy document for your grade. Any expense in excess of these limits needs prior approval from your reporting manager. Sales and service field employees will be eligible for the advance Imprest amount as per traveling policy which should be used for official traveling only. The Imprest amount needs to be settled at the time of your exit from company and adjusted in full and final settlement.


9. Deductions:


During your employment or in the event of termination of your services, the Company is entitled to deduct the amount due from you to the Company from actual total compensation including but not limited to

  • Any debt or advance for the time being owed by you to the Company;
  • Any deduction related to leave or holidays taken in excess of entitlement as on the date of termination of employment;
  • Any deduction with respect to expenses incurred by the Company, or the cost of repairing damage to the Company's property caused by you (including the cost of recovering the same).

10. Training


You will be imparted training on-the-job as well as periodically as and when the training programs will be organized. The Company lays high importance on training its employees and spends considerable resources on it. Dedicated and committed participation from employee side is expected during the training period.


11. Probation / Confirmation:


You will be on Probation for Six months. If your services are found satisfactory during the probation period, you will be confirmed in the present position. However, the period of probation may be extended at the discretion of the Management if they need more time to evaluate your performance. You will continue to be on probation till an order of confirmation has been issued in writing. During probation period your services can be terminated with 15 days notice on either side and without any reasons whatsoever. Once confirmed, your position shall be as a full time employee with the Company and you shall devote yourself exclusively to the business and interests of the company.


12. Work Conduct:


  1. 12.1 During your employment with the Company, you shall devote your best efforts for promoting the Company's (and of any other relevant affiliate and / or business associate of the Company) business.
  2. 12.2 You are required to effectively carry out all duties and responsibilities as assigned to you by the Company and shall faithfully and diligently perform these in compliance with established policies and procedures, endeavouring to the best of your ability to protect and promote the interests of the Company.
  3. 12.3 You shall not, except with the written permission of the Company, engage directly or indirectly in any other business, occupation or activity, whether as a principal agent or otherwise which will be detrimental to the Company's interests.
  4. 12.4 You will obey the lawful commands and directions of your senior / reporting head and to the best of your abilities execute such work as your senior / reporting head or the Directors may entrust you from time to time.
  5. 12.5 Without permission in writing of the Board of Directors of the Company, you will not take up any other work for remuneration (part time or otherwise) or work in an advisory capacity or be interested directly or indirectly (except as shareholder / debenture holder), in any other trade or business during your employment with the company. You will also not seek membership of any local or public bodies without first obtaining specific permission from the Management.
  6. 12.6 You will be bound by the Code of Conduct and all other rules, regulations, policies and orders issued by the Company from time to time in relation to your conduct, discipline rules, regulation, policies et al, which are part of this contract of appointment.

13. Responsibilities & Duties


Your work in the organization will be subject to the rules and regulations of the organization as laid down in relation to conduct and other matters. You will always be aware of the responsibilities and duties attached to your office and conduct yourself accordingly. You must effectively perform to ensure results. The Employee shall maintain high standards of discipline, efficiency, integrity and guide the employees under his/her supervision to the best of his/her ability.

All other functions and responsibilities which are part of the role assigned to the Employee shall be explained to the Employee by his / her manager / immediate supervisor.

The Employee shall provide all necessary assistance to the Company for the purpose of keeping and maintaining files, documents, books of accounts and all other necessary records in accordance with the Company's policy and the applicable law.


14. Appraisals /Increments/ Promotion:


Increment and Promotion will not be given as a matter of right or routine. Promotion & Increment will be subject to your performance against job objectives, initiatives, work outputs, punctuality, discipline, efficiency and other parameters.

Appraisal/increment/ promotion will be done based on the company's performance for the year and also Department & Individual performance.

Performance evaluation and implementation will be done as per the Appraisal policy and processes which are implemented by the company for calendar year.


15. Disclosure of Information:


You hereby confirm that you have disclosed all your business interests in the Company whether or not they are similar to or in conflict with the business(es) or the activities of the Company, & all circumstances in respect of which there is, or there might be perceived, a conflict of interest between the Company and you or any immediate relatives. Also, you agree to immediately disclose to the Company any such interests or circumstances which may arise during your employment.


16 . Confidentiality:


  1. 16.1 All information regarding the affairs or business matters of the Company (and of any other relevant affiliate and/or business associate of the Company) -- concepts, working methods, client portfolios, strategies -- that come to your knowledge by reasons of your employment is deemed to be confidential and considered a trade secret.
  2. 16.2 You shall be required to maintain strict confidentiality of such information and data that may come to your possession or knowledge by virtue of the engagement, use it only as may be required in the normal course of your work and shall not disclose or divulge any information or data, without prior consent of an authorized officer of the Company.
  3. 16.3 You shall at all times keep the details of your salary and employment benefits received from the Company, strictly confidential and shall not disclose such details to any other person within the Company.
  4. 16.4 You shall use the Company name, Logos, trademarks or other identifiers strictly in the manner permitted by the Company's policies or for the purposes of provision of Services delegated to you to the extent required.
  5. 16.5 You shall at all times, whether during your term of employment or thereafter or upon termination of your employment, act with utmost confidentiality and shall not disclose or divulge any such confidential information to third parties or make use of such information for your own benefit or the benefit of any third party.

This clause applies during the employment and continues for 24 months after expiry or termination of employment. Failure to adherence to this clause will invite legal action by the Company.


17. Intellectual Property


If you conceive any new or advanced method of improving designs / processes / formulae / systems, etc. in relation to the business / operations of the Company, such developments will be fully communicated to the company and will be and remain the sole right/intellectual property of the Company. You will be required to maintain utmost secrecy in respect of Project documents, commercial offers, design documents, Project cost & Estimation, Technology, Software package license, Company's policy, Company's patterns & Trademark and Company's Human assets profile. Also, the usage of personal USB Drives and CD ROMs are strictly prohibited within the organization. In any case. If you want any kind of data, inform the immediate superior authority and he/she will provide the same.


18. IT and Data Protection:


The Employee agrees to follow the data protection and IT rules of the Company. The policy will be shared with you at the time of induction. The safety and security of IT assets and data is your responsibility. If company finds any wrongful use of given assets, it can penalize you with appropriate cost of damages.


19. Monitoring Policy:


Please note that emails sent to you and by you may be monitored from time to time for the purpose of identifying any non-compliance with the Company policies or applicable laws. These emails along with attachments are considered as property of the company.

If such monitoring discloses breach of any law or Company policies, disciplinary action may follow including termination of the employment.


20. Notice Period:


During the probation (including any extension), services may be terminated by either party, giving written notice of 15 days or payment of salary for equivalent days in Lieu of thereof.

Post confirmation, services may be terminated by either party, giving {{ doc.notice_period or '' }} notice. Any extension or reduction in notice period will be the decision of management only. In case of short notice from employee side, under approval from management, will attract deduction of salary for the short days. Short notice period from employee without approval of management will attract deduction of short days and non-issuance of relieving and experience letters.

During notice period you are not allowed to participate in any legal discussion or any professional training.

You are required to identify and train your replacement and facilitate a successful handover/knowledge transfer. Failure to comply with the clause would be considered breach of the Company policy.

The Company reserves the right to terminate your employment on the grounds mentioned in clause 21 below. In such an event, you will be subject to immediate dismissal and the Company will not be liable to give you pay for the notice period. The Company further reserves the right to initiate legal action as it deems fit.


21. Termination of Services:


If at any time during the course of your employment, it is found that you have made a false or an incomplete declaration with regard to your qualification / experience and other detail, your appointment will be treated void with immediate effect without any payment in lieu of notice period. The Company may terminate / suspend your services at its discretion at any time immediately upon written notice to you if it has been alleged and prima facie established through preliminary internal inquiry that you have committed (i) any heinous criminal act or any offense involving moral turpitude. Examples include rape, forgery, robbery, etc. (ii) sexual harassment or (iii) other act that threatens or likely to damage the Company's reputation.

If at any time during the course of your employment, it is found that you have committed any act of gross misconduct or fraud or serious breach of employment terms, been guilty of conduct tending to bring yourself or the Company into disrepute, been absent for a continuous period of 10 days without approval/information, indulged in policy violation/fraud/financial irregularities and/or been found to demonstrate unsatisfactory job performance, your services will be terminated and you shall not be entitled to any notice period or payment in lieu thereof.


22. Retirement /Superannuation:


The age of your retirement is 58 years. You will be intimated about your retirement age 6 months ahead by HR department. Your retirement can be extended according to the process mentioned in retirement policy.


23. Return of Company Property


You shall promptly upon request by the Company and in event of expiry or termination of your employment, return and surrender the Company laptop and other assigned assets, all such confidential information, data, files, books, magazines, reports, documents, manuals, any knowledge database including without limitation, in whatever form including but not limited to electronically held data that concerns the business of the Company which may have been prepared by you or come into your possession, custody or control in the course of your employment. You shall not keep any copies of these items in any form whatsoever. Violation of this clause may invite legal action.


24. Non -- Competition:


In the event of your separation from Company for whatever reason:

  1. 24.1 For a period of 2 years thereafter you will not solicit business in competition with the Company nor pass information to a third party that may result in the same effect from any other organization which is at the date of separation, a client or a prospect with whom negotiations are underway. Neither will you in competition, offer or supply products or services which compete directly with those products or services offered by the Company.
  2. 24.2 You agree that for a period of 2 years after your separation from the Company you will not endeavour to solicit or entice away any person who is an employee of the Company or who was in its employment up to 6 months preceding your separation.

25. Others:


  1. 25.1 Under the Sexual Harassment Prevention Act. 2013, sexual harassment is considered a misconduct. The consequences of such misconduct can be -- apart from deduction of wages, termination of employment or transfer to another location.
  2. 25.2 Your appointment is contingent upon Medical Fitness Certificate, satisfactory reference background checks, including verification of your application materials, education, and employment history. Your employment is also contingent upon your ability to work for the Company without restriction (i.e. you do not have any non-compete obligation or other restrictive clauses with any previous employer).
  3. 25.3 You will be governed by the Company's policies during the course of your employment. It will be obligatory on your part to ensure compliance to the applicable statutes, regulations and requirements laid down by the Company and other regulatory and statutory bodies. Violation of the terms and conditions mentioned herein would attract disciplinary and/or legal action, including immediate termination.

The Company reserves the right to amend the policies from time to time. You are advised to keep yourself updated on these policies and abide by the same.


We take this opportunity to congratulate you on your selection and welcome you to IndiFOSS Analytical Pvt Ltd. and look forward to a long and mutually beneficial professional association. You are joining us at an exciting phase of our journey for building a world class Organisation and we are counting on you to help us get there.


Kindly return a copy of this letter duly signed by you in acceptance of the terms and conditions set out herein.


Thanking you,

For IndiFOSS Analytical Pvt. Ltd Accepted On _______________________
